page.title: 15Church Farm, Claines
page.content: Mr Peter Philips owns the farm in partnership with his son, Peter. The family has owned the farm since 1900. There are 550 acres. Crops grown include sugar beet, fodder beet, barley, potatoes, sprouts, beans, cabbages, cauliflowers and peas. Beef cattle are kept, the calves being bought at a week old and fattened for market. Five people work on the farm. Work begins at 7.30 am, lunch is 1 to 2 pm and finishes at 5 pm. The farmworkers have 4 weeks' holiday per year. They need special clothing for wet weather and for spraying chemicals. The farmer keeps a record of what he does in a large diary. There are five farmhouses, twenty barns and buildings and seven tractors in use. There is also a great deal of other machinery.
